parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: Methistano meth-is-tan'-o from meta and histemi; to transfer, i.e. Carry away, depose or exchange, seduce.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Management of household affairs, stewardship, administration. From oikonomos; administration; specially, a 'economy'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural

str2: A dwelling; by implication, a family.
